jobs.description:
**Description:**

* Job Title: **Lifecycle Marketing Manager** – ABC Carpet & Home Flagship Store, NYC
* Location: New York City, NY
* Position Type: Full-Time, On-Site

Join Our Team at ABC Carpet & Home - Flagship, New York

**ABC Carpet & Home 's Mission:**

Known as the most iconic Home Design destination in New York, our mission is to bring our magic and colorful vision to the world through a unique and unparalleled curation of rugs, furniture and décor.

ABC Carpet & Home is a 150+ year old privately and family-owned company with an entrepreneurial culture.

We are currently seeking a dedicated and experienced **Lifecycle Marketing Manager** to join our New York team.

**The Opportunity:**

We are a luxury home and carpet store seeking an experienced Lifecycle Marketing Manager to join our team. This person will be responsible for developing and optimizing multi-channel customer journeys to drive engagement, retention, and revenue throughout the customer lifecycle. This role will own the strategy and execution of programs across email, SMS, direct mail, and other channels, using data-driven insights to deliver personalized experiences at scale.They should be comfortable implementing brand strategies, marketing plans, and project management for all marketing initiatives, and working cross-functionally to execute these strategies. This is a full-time position in office.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Drive strong email and SMS campaigns to acquire and retain customers across our product portfolio
* Spearhead all new marketing product launches to drive repeat and new revenue
* Coordinate cross-functionally to ensure consistency in brand-related decisions
* Analyze and report on brand performance across channels, including but not limited to: direct mail, email, SMS
* Monitor market and consumer trends within the interior design and home space
* Project management for all marketing projects, serving as the glue between dev, merchandising, and ecomm teams

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree
* 3-6+ years of experience in lifecycle, retention, or CRM marketing, preferably in a direct-to-consumer or ecommerce environment.
* Proven success managing customer journeys and automated campaigns across digital channels.
* Strong analytical mindset; comfortable working with large datasets and drawing actionable insights.
* Hands-on experience with marketing automation platforms and CRM tools.
* Excellent project management skills with the ability to lead cross-functional initiatives.
* Strong copywriting skills and a keen eye for creative and brand voice.
* Passionate about customer experience, personalization, and performance marketing.
* Experience in home furnishings or interior design is preferred but not required
* Experience working in: Klaviyo, Attentive, Google Analytics, Shopify, Asana a plus.

**Compensation Details:**

Starting Salary:

We offer a competitive salary ranging from $90,000 to $110,000, depending on your experience and qualifications. Our commitment to equitable pay means we regularly adjust our ranges to stay compliant with state and local laws, ensuring our team members are rewarded fairly for their expertise and dedication.

jobs.description:
Alfred Williams & Company is seeking an **Account Manager** focused on Business Development to drive growth through proactive outreach, relationship building and exceptional client service. You’ll develop new opportunities, expand existing accounts and partner closely with design, project management and customer administration to deliver outstanding workplace solutions.

**Responsibilities**

* Identify, qualify and close new business opportunities.
* Understand client goals and align solutions to business objectives.
* Proactively build and maintain a strong network (A+D firms, commercial real estate, brokers, end users, etc.).
* Own relationships with clients while serving as the primary point of contact.
* Manage day-to-day account needs and advocate for the customer throughout the project lifecycle.
* Lead internal and external meetings, clearly articulate scope, priorities and next steps.
* Coordinate with internal partners (Designer, Project Manager, Project Coordinator) to ensure quality delivery.
* Oversee project timelines, budgets, and change management; escalate risks early.
* Consistently exceed client expectations and add value to strategic and creative conversations.
* Track pipeline activity, forecasts, and progress toward goals.

**Qualifications**

* **2+ years** of relevant experience in commercial furniture, Design, real estate or construction industries.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills; confident presenter and facilitator.
* Self-starter who is proactive, flexible, and comfortable managing multiple projects and deadlines.
* Excellent prioritization, organization, and follow-through.
* Familiarity with proposals, budgeting and basic contract terms.
* Capable of reading and understanding floorplans, AutoCAD, etc.
* Knowledge of the A+D community, commercial real estate ecosystem and project delivery process.

jobs.description:
About Us:

Founded in 1992, Pennsylvania, USA, by current URBN chairman and president Dick Hayne, Anthropologie was named after his college major (with a decidedly French twist) Anthropologie, which now operates over 200 stores worldwide, has evolved into a leading one-of-a-kind destination for those seeking a curated mix of clothing, accessories, gifts and home décor to reflect their personal style. In 2009 the brand launched its first store in London and now has over 18 stores in the UK and Europe.

Role Summary:

**This is a 12 month FTC and we are looking for a start date of March/beginning of April**

As Digital Merchandising & Production Manager, you’ll lead the visual merchandising and digital content strategy across our e-commerce platform. Acting as the bridge between trading, buying, marketing, and tech teams, you’ll oversee the execution of homepage, category, and product pages to reflect commercial priorities and brand goals. You’ll also drive product activation, manage the digital product pipeline, and champion SEO and content enhancements to elevate the customer journey. With a strong grasp of systems and a proactive approach to system optimisations, you’ll play a key role in shaping the future of our digital experience. You will be managing and supporting a team.

What You'll Be Doing:

Merchandising & Site Content

* Own & deliver on visual site merchandising strategy
* Owns all content on site, ensuring engaging and inspiring to support customer discoverability
* Works closely with Trade on successful execution of site strategy across page optimisations, content callouts, filters, category structure, page merchandising and other site changes to support product discoverability & CVR.
* Oversees execution of homepage & other content pages and ensure they reflect trading priorities and CVR optimisations alongside brand goals
* Liaison between buying, marketing to ensure campaign launch ready (site, product, links..)

Tech & System Optimisations

* Champion tech roadmap optimisations & a go between tech and the business
* Reports tech issues & liaises with tech on issues & opportunities
* Systems expert & seeks opportunities to improve processes

Product Activation

* Plan & oversee product launches across the website
* Manages the digital product pipeline and ensures accurate, timely product uploads in coordination with Buying and Planning.
* Owns product attribution, SEO tagging, and content optimization (e.g., product descriptions, imagery, styling).
* Identifies and resolves product & content gaps to support conversion and improve the customer journey

What You'll Need:

* A proactive, positive and energetic attitude, you’re someone who gets stuck in, solves problems quickly, and brings ideas to the table with enthusiasm
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a sharp eye for emerging talent and unique opportunities
* Management experience
* Strong experience tracking, analysing and reporting on both digital and physical activations
* A people-first attitude and the ability to build rapport quickly both internally and externally
* Super-organised whilst still being flexible, with the ability to juggle multiple projects, meet deadlines and stay calm under pressure
* Digitally confident, with strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite
* Familiarity with performance-tracking tools essential, both native metrics and 3rd-party platforms (i.e. Dash Social, GRIN, Plot)
* Creative and commercially aware, always thinking about how to drive awareness and impact for the brand

The Perks:

* Work-life balance:

* Flexible start and finish times
* Bring your dog to work
* Wellbeing:

* Employees Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial health
* Fully equipped free gym and on-site wellness room in Brick Lane and 50% discount of external gym memberships
* Private Medical Insurance
* Employee Discount:
* Up to 40% off at all URBN Brands
* Community:
* One paid day to either volunteer or fundraise for a charity of your choice
* Travel:
* Cycle to work scheme, season ticket loan
* Continued Development:
* We offer structured support within the business alongside continued learning and development

#AnthroEU

About Us:

Founded in 1992, Pennsylvania, USA, by current URBN chairman and president Dick Hayne, Anthropologie was named after his college major (with a decidedly French twist) Anthropologie, which now operates over 200 stores worldwide, has evolved into a leading one-of-a-kind destination for those seeking a curated mix of clothing, accessories, gifts and home décor to reflect their personal style. In 2009 the brand launched its first store in London and now has over 18 stores in the UK and Europe.

Role Summary:

We are looking for a highly skilled Digital Marketing Manager with a proven track record of driving growth across Paid Search, Paid Social, Display, Affiliates and SEO in the UK and wider European markets. This is a pivotal role within the business for improving ROAS and growing all digital marketing channels in line with business goals.

What You'll Be Doing:

* Supporting the Head of Digital Marketing in the development, management and execution of the Anthropologie EU digital marketing strategy
* Management of external digital marketing agencies, ensuring delivery of channel strategy and performance through challenging partners on performance & areas for opportunities
* Support the Head of Digital Marketing with forecasting channel traffic, demand, spend and efficiency
* Manage daily, weekly, monthly, and ad hoc reporting to deliver growth across marketing channels and strategic priorities
* Deliver on clear investment targets across paid channels, ensuring spend & efficiency is aligned to forecasts
* Through analysis, seek opportunities to drive growth & optimise performance across marketing channels
* Manage in-house paid social marketing, through ad planning, optimised investment and review of ad performance.
* Partner with the organic social team on the paid social strategy and cross-funnel budget
* Manage the marketing feeds and work with agency on optimisations
* Manage Affiliate tenancy and commission opportunities, in line with our marketing calendar
* Work closely with the online trading, brand marketing and buying teams to ensure ads and product focuses are aligned with business priorities and trends
* Partner with the ecommerce trading and web production team on SEO recommendations and optimisations
* Management of the Digital Marketing Assistant
* Identify and driver opportunities to grow Digital Marketing channels through new vendors and projects
* Attend weekly, monthly and ad hoc trade meetings, presenting trade and highlighting opportunities to further grow the business

What You'll Need:

* Project management experience
* Confident in all areas of online marketing, with experience in managing multiple activities.
* A confident communicator and willing to influencer through best practice and ROAS

* Ability to analyse marketing campaigns and present strategies based on results
* Strong leadership skills and experience with managing a team
* Ability to multi-task and delegate
* Build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders

The Perks:  

* Work-life balance:
* Flexible start and finish times
* Bring your dog to work

* Employees Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial health
* Fully equipped free gym and on-site wellness room in Brick Lane and 50% discount off external gym memberships

* We offer structured support within the business alongside continued learning and development

Anthropologie is looking for an Influencer Marketing Coordinator. The Influencer Marketing Coordinator will support the day-to-day of the Anthropologie influencer marketing team. This person will report to the Influencer Marketing Associate and partner with Anthropologie’s crossfunctional teams to support the execution of the Anthropologie, AnthroLiving and BHLDN influencer campaigns and giftings.  
  
**Role Responsibilities**

* Assist in management of Influencer campaigns for Anthropologie , AnthroLiving and AnthroWeddings. Including but not limited to:

+ Expand Anthropologie brand awareness by staying up-to-date on up-and-coming influencers excelling in reach and engagement KPIs as well as brand relevant content to test within Anthropologie campaigns
+ Assist in the curation of face sheets, cast scouting for campaigns and contracts
+ Manage campaign timelines and coordination of campaign launch from following up of content concepts, placing product orders, managing content deadlines, initial content approvals, tracking live content and reporting
+ Ensure that product selections adhere to campaign concept and brief parameters prior to placing orders as well as site availability. When orders are placed, manage all steps inclusive of order tracking & resolving order issues
+ Curate product SKU lists to pass off to web dev. team for anthropologie.com linking purposes and create UTMs to provide Influencers for content
+ Capture live content inclusive of IG Stories and ensuring all deliverable obligations are met and track all content on monday.com
+ Ensure social teams are supporting live influencer content via community management
+ Coordinate with digital team on content available for paid social needs and assist in whitelisting strategy by ensuring branded content tool is utilized
+ Assist in ambassador initiatives including but not limited to: campaign launch process, bonus campaigns, collecting reviews, outfitting program coordination, co-op campaigns

* Manage regular pulse of influencer giftings process including but not limited to:

+ Recommending key product gifting opportunities during key calendar moments
+ Coordinate with art team on asset needs: packaging, card inserts, handwritten notes
+ Coordinate with digital teams on landing page experiences, UTMs, QR codes, etc.
+ Coordinate with product teams to curate a personalized gifting product selection that relates to story/brand message being told via gifting
+ Place gifting product orders and manage gifting package process inclusive of sending gifts and coordinate tracking
+ Coordinate entire process of opportunistic influencer giftings
+ Assist in execution of the celebrity home giftings program including but not limited to order placements, inventory checking, landing page coordination, recapping

* Experiences and Events:

+ Assist in casting for Anthropologie brand events and experiences
+ Partner with cross functional teams on invitation assets, casting expectations, casting approvals and product orders
+ Manage outfitting process for influencer attendees

* Budget:

+ Assist in Influencer budget coordination in a timely manner including:
+ Invoice submission assistance
+ Monthly finance tracker and trial balance completion

* Recapping:

+ Ensure all influencer partners are verified on Creator IQ to accurately pull performance
+ Partner with Influencer Associate on pulling together performance metrics to create actionable takeaways and recapping for campaigns
+ Outreach to gifting recipients or event attendees for their account reporting if deliverables aren’t required
+ Responsible for recapping and reporting on content for all giftings and events

**Role Qualifications**

* 1+ years influencer management and/or social media experience desired
* A charismatic and proactive style of communication desired for external communication
* Strong organization skills inclusive of building timelines and tracking weekly and daily product orders and able to work on a variety of projects at one time in a fast-paced environment
* Strong writing and communication skills

About Us:

Founded in 1992, Pennsylvania, USA, by current URBN chairman and president Dick Hayne, Anthropologie was named after his college major (with a decidedly French twist) Anthropologie, which now operates over 200 stores worldwide, has evolved into a leading one-of-a-kind destination for those seeking a curated mix of clothing, accessories, gifts and home décor to reflect their personal style. In 2009 the brand launched its first store in London and now has over 18 stores in the UK and Europe.

Role Summary:

As Marketing Planning Manager, you’ll play a key role in leading Anthropologie’s brand campaign planning across Europe, with a particular focus on 360 marketing campaigns, retail and trade marketing and project management. Supporting teams across Brand Marketing, Creative, Digital Marketing and Retail, you will lead the planning and delivery of standout omni-channel campaigns activated across in-store, owned, earned and paid channels. You’ll also set-up efficient ways of working and communicating across department and be a key marketing contact across the business.

What You'll Be Doing:

*Campaign Project Management:*

* Take the lead on marketing campaigns and activations, project managing from concept to delivery, working with Brand & Creative, Digital, Product and Retail teams to scope requirements, plan deliverables, manage budgets and deliver campaigns on time
* Own the brand marketing calendar, working closely with US & EU colleagues to align global campaign messaging amplification, and identify and communicate EU-only messages
* Support the Brand Executive on campaign briefing, ensuring cross-departmental briefs are clear and completed by all departments
* Track creative and channel deliverables using project management tools, keeping stakeholders updated on key milestones and actions
* Lead post-campaign reporting and analysis, creating weekly, monthly and quarterly tracking against key metrics, working across teams to collate and present results and learnings to wider teams

*Retail & Trade Marketing:*

* Assist the Senior Brand Marketing Manager to brief and deliver all in-store POS
* Contribute to the successful launch and ongoing marketing of new Anthropologie stores, helping to develop opening plans and overseeing execution of planned activity
* Work with Retail and Digital teams to plan promotional messaging into the marketing calendar, capture Creative requirements and brief Creative teams

*Planning Processes:*

* Create ongoing efficiencies and review ways of working across teams to more effectively plan and manage marketing processes and communication
* Input into monthly and campaign Budget planning and tracking alongside Brand, Influencer, Social, and PR teams, reviewing regularly with the Marketing Director and Finance team
* Own regular planning meetings, campaign kick-offs & channel alignments, and support channel teams on their planning
* Onboard Brand & Creative teams onto a new project management tool, and set up campaign planning functionality

What You'll Need:

* A proactive, positive and energetic attitude, you’re someone who gets stuck in, solves problems quickly, and brings ideas to the table with enthusiasm
* Experience in Marketing Project Management or Brand Marketing ideally in Retail (either in-house or agency) with a strong knowledge of 360 campaign planning processes and deliverables
* Demonstrable experience in planning and delivering 360 brand awareness and performance-driven campaigns, partnerships, and experiential activations
* Highly-organised with strong planning and process optimisation skills, and the ability to be flexible, juggle multiple projects, meet deadlines and stay calm under pressure
* Strong experience tracking, analysing and reporting on both digital and physical activations
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Confident at communicating with senior stakeholders and with across global teams, and the ability to build rapport quickly both internally and externally
* Digitally confident, with strong working knowledge of Google and Microsoft office tools, as well as project planning tools such as Asana, Trello and Figma
* Strong understanding of performance and results tracking, and familiarity with performance-tracking tools, both native metrics and 3rd-party platforms
* Creative and commercially aware, always thinking about how to drive awareness and impact for the brand
* Ability to recognise and ensure activations are on-brand and of the high creative standard our customers expect of Anthropologie, aligning with the global brand identity

The Perks:

Work-life balance:  

* Flexible start and finish times

* Bring your dog to work

* Employees Assistance program to support with mental, physical and financial health

jobs.description:
Arhaus was founded in 1986 on a simple idea: Furniture and décor should be sustainably sourced, lovingly made, and built to last. Today, we partner with artisans around the world who share our vision, creating beautiful, heirloom-quality pieces that can be used—and loved—for generations.

Arhaus is seeking a Senior Graphic Designer, Digital to join their Creative team. The ideal candidate will be able to translate strategic insights into brand defining creative storytelling, have a high attention to detail, be able to drive creative innovation, and manage the creative design process. As a Senior Graphic Designer, Digital, you'll be responsible for the concepting, execution and on-time delivery of high-quality creative materials across marketing channels with a focus on building the Arhaus brand, engaging customers, and driving business results.

**Essential Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Lead and manage the creative design process from concept to completion, ensuring that all deliverables support Arhaus brand pillars, engaging customers, and driving business results
* Partner with copywriters and marketing partners to brainstorm, design and develop creative work for various campaigns, including print ads, digital banners, social media content, and other marketing materials.
* Design materials that enhance the Arhaus brand and the overall customer experience
* Drive innovation with editorial storytelling approach that elevates customer engagement
* Provide expertise that pushes the team to do the most effective and elevated work possible
* Demonstrate exceptional creative concepting ability across multiple marketing channels, as evidenced by a diverse portfolio of work
* Translate strategic insights into effective and highly creative ideas
* Oversee and mentor designers, providing guidance and feedback to ensure their professional growth and the quality of their work.
* Partner with Marketing leads to grow the business and explore new business opportunities
* Manage multiple projects and deliverables simultaneously
* Maintain accountability for overall quality of creative work
* Conduct and participate in design reviews with a range of stakeholders across the organization

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor or Master’s degree in Advertising, Communications, Design, or other related field (or other relevant equivalent)
* 7+ years of experience in Art Direction
* Fluent in Adobe Suite
* Strong conceptual and visual storytelling skills, with an exceptional portfolio showcasing a range of campaign work..
* Strong understanding of design principles, typography, color theory, and layout design.
* Ability to balance big-picture creative thinking with hands-on design execution.
* Strong project management skills and ability to function as project leader influencing others as well as individual contributor. Able to work well in cross-functional teams.
* Strong leadership skills and the ability to mentor and guide junior team members.
* Team Player – Must be able to manage and work with various members of creative, ecommerce and social teams
* Must be organized and able to prioritize, multi-task and work independently
* Fluent in English, with excellent communication, presentation, and social skills
* Strong communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills including the ability to communicate design concepts appropriately to different audiences and varying levels of the organization

Job Details  
  
**Description**Job Description  
  
Since 1986, our mission has been simple. We design and build heirloom quality products while holding true to our commitment to use earth-friendly materials and to give back whenever possible. We are looking for a strategic and passionate leader who shares our love of story-telling and believes passionately in the value of heirloom quality artisan furniture, sustainability, and our mission to continue to learn and grow as a brand.  
  
Arhaus is seeking a Manager, Growth Marketing to lead our paid media strategy and execution across paid social, display, video, search and emerging channels. In this highly data-driven, creative role, this individual will be instrumental in shaping and scaling our digital presence, driving profitable growth and brand affinity through innovative campaigns and rigorous performance optimization. Reporting to the Director, Content & Growth Marketing, this leader will own the strategy, planning, execution, budget management and performance across all growth channels and will directly lead and oversee a team of specialists, ensuring both team and channel success. This position is located on-site at our Corporate Headquarters in Boston Heights, OH.  
  
Key Responsibilities

* Own the growth marketing strategy across paid social, display, video, and search, aligning campaigns with business objectives
* Develop full-funnel paid media plans that drive awareness, engagement, and conversion while maximizing efficiency
* Set channel KPIs and manage budgets, ensuring delivery against sales and ROI targets
* Lead cross-functional collaboration, partnering closely with Creative, Analytics, and Ecom to deliver best-in-class campaigns
* Oversee in platform activation and optimization across all platforms refining targeting, bidding, creative and landing page strategies
* Translate performance data into insights, providing actionable recommendations to stakeholders and senior leadership
* Manage vendor relationships to ensure alignment, performance and continuous growth
* Continuously test and evolve campaigns and strategies, building roadmaps for creative, audience, and channel innovations
* Lead and develop a high-performing team, providing coaching, feedback, and career development opportunities for direct reports
* Stay ahead of industry trends and platform updates to inform strategy and maintain competitive advantage

**Required Experience**

* 4+ years of growth or performance marketing experience, including strategic planning, performance optimization and hands-on execution of multi million dollar programs
* Demonstrated leadership and people management experience, with proven success managing direct reports
* Deep understanding of the digital advertising ecosystem, including campaign structure, audience segmentation, bidding strategies, and attribution modeling
* Demonstrated understanding and experiencing in full funnel strategy
* Strong storytelling skills with the ability to distill complex data into insights for stakeholders and senior leadership
* Data-driven problem solving skills, with a desire to look for opportunities through data analysis and to take action on them
* Experience in a fast-paced environment where deadlines, priorities, and initiatives pivot at the speed of digital trends
* Self-starter with exceptional organizational, prioritization, and communication skills, with the ability to lead both teams and cross-functional partners

**Preferred Experience**

* Familiarity with multiple forms of analytics and measurement tools (ie A/B + Brand/Conversion Lift Testing, GA4, Media Mixed Modeling, etc)
* Experience with retail and/or eCommerce D2C brands
* Understanding of retail calendar and seasonal process
* Passion for digital innovation, consumer trends, and the intersection of brand and performance marketing

Arhaus was founded in 1986 on a simple idea: Furniture and décor should be sustainably sourced, lovingly made, and built to last. Today, we partner with artisans around the world who share our vision, creating beautiful, heirloom-quality pieces that can be used—and loved—for generations.

**Essential Duties & Responsibilities:**

The Vice President of Commerce and Marketing Technology will be a visionary leader responsible for shaping and executing the company’s commerce strategy across retail, eCommerce, and emerging marketing technology platforms. This executive will drive innovation, enhance customer engagement, and deliver seamless, personalized shopping experiences through cutting-edge technology and is responsible for delivery and continuous improvement of all customer-facing technology platforms that drive revenue and brand engagement. This includes ownership of the enterprise **e-commerce, point-of-sale (POS), order management, CRM, loyalty, and marketing technology ecosystems**. The role requires a proven track record of leading large-scale technology initiatives preferably with Shopify experience, fostering innovation, and aligning technology with business goals in a fast-paced retail environment.

**Commerce and Marketing Strategy & Leadership**

* Develop and execute the technology vision for commerce and marketing technologies to accelerate growth and profitability.
* Partner with executive leadership to align innovation roadmaps with overall business objectives.
* Lead a high-performing technology organization (blend of internal and external teams), fostering a culture of innovation, agility, and continuous improvement.

**Commerce and Marketing Platform Management**

* Lead the vision, design, and lifecycle of e-commerce, POS, OMS, and CRM systems (e.g., Shopify, Manhattan Active Omni, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, or similar).
* Oversee integrations between ERP, WMS, PIM, and digital front-ends to ensure real-time inventory visibility, accurate pricing, and personalized marketing.
* Champion enterprise data integration and governance across the martech stack (CDP, analytics, tagging, and privacy compliance).
* Ensure scalability, security, and performance of commerce and marketing platforms to support rapid growth and evolving customer needs.
* Drive enhancements in digital merchandising, personalization, payment solutions, and omnichannel integration.

**Innovation & Emerging Technology**

* Identify and deploy emerging technologies that enhance the retail experience and operational efficiency.
* Establish partnerships with technology providers, startups, and innovation labs to stay ahead of market trends.
* Pilot and scale new digital experiences that deepen customer engagement and loyalty.

**Customer Experience & Data**

* Ensure a frictionless omnichannel journey—online, mobile, and in-store—through unified authentication, cart persistence, and loyalty experiences.
* Enable store associates with reliable POS and clienteling tools that reflect real-time customer and product data.
* Partner with Marketing and Customer Insights to leverage martech capabilities for personalization, automation, and A/B testing. Lead efforts to deliver personalized, data-driven customer journeys across channels.
* Leverage analytics, customer insights, and predictive modeling to optimize product recommendations, promotions, and digital content.
* Champion a customer-first mindset in all technology initiatives.

**Operational Excellence**

* Oversee technology budgets, vendor relationships, and enterprise platform investments.
* Implement best practices for governance, cybersecurity, compliance, and risk management.
* Partner with store operations, supply chain, and marketing to enable seamless omnichannel experiences.

**Requirements:**

* 15+ years of technology leadership experience, with at least 7 years in senior roles overseeing engineering, operations and best practices.
* Commerce and/or marketing technology management in retail or consumer-facing industries.
* Strong background in enterprise architecture, digital commerce platforms, and customer experience technologies.
* Demonstrated success in leading digital transformation and delivering measurable business impact.

**Marketing Specialist, Partnerships – OnSite: Tampa, FL**

Ashley is seeking a Specialist, Strategic Partnerships to join our dynamic Field Marketing & Partnerships team. This role is your gateway to managing a large sports & entertainment portfolio spanning NFL, NBA, MLB, NHL, and top collegiate programs.

**What You'll Do:**

You'll be the driving force behind 40+ activations across 9 professional and 3 collegiate partnerships, executing everything from in-venue signage and paid media campaigns to VIP hospitality and sweepstakes. You'll collaborate across Marketing, Creative, PR, and Retail teams to bring high-impact brand moments to life, while tracking performance data that proves ROI.

**What We're Looking For:**

A detail-obsessed project manager with 1–3 years in marketing partnerships, sponsorships, or event execution (sports/entertainment background strongly preferred). You thrive in fast-paced environments, juggle multiple campaigns with ease, and bring strong organizational chops plus proficiency in Microsoft Office and project management tools.

**Why This Role Matters:**

You'll protect Ashley's strategic assets, ensure flawless delivery, and free senior leaders to focus on growth, all while traveling 20–30% for on-site activations that put you courtside, rinkside, and in the heart of the action.

* Execute contractual deliverables including in-venue signage, paid media, sweepstakes, in-store activations, and digital/social campaigns.

* Lead logistics for activations: ticketing, hospitality, VIPs, promotions, and on-site event support.
* Collaborate with Marketing, Creative, PR, Retail, and Community teams to integrate campaigns into national brand moments.

* Serve as a professional liaison with partners and vendors, escalating relationship management to the Manager as needed.

**Qualifications**

jobs.description:
**Director of Product Marketing – OnSite: Tampa, FL**

**About the Role:**

We are seeking a seasoned **Director of Product Marketing** to define and lead the strategy, positioning, and execution of product launches across our multi-brand home and furniture portfolio. This highly visible leadership role serves as the central connector across Merchandising, Product Development, Sales, Marketing, and Creative, ensuring each product enters the market with precision, consistency, and impact. You will own the go-to-market (GTM) strategy, develop scalable product messaging and positioning frameworks, and guide a high-performing team in bringing new collections to market across direct-to-consumer, retail, wholesale, and marketplace channels. This role offers the opportunity to shape category leadership, drive meaningful growth, and elevate how our brands engage customers across a diverse and evolving landscape.

*To be considered for this opportunity, you must be able to commute to Ashley’s Corporate Office in Tampa, FL. Relocation assistance is available for qualified candidates.*

**Why This Opportunity Is Special:**

* **Build the Foundation:** This is a unique opportunity to architect the Product Marketing function from the ground up at the largest furniture manufacturer in America.
* **Lead Through Influence:** You’ll sit at the center of our business—where strategy meets storytelling and product meets customer.
* **Be a Category Shaper:** We’re launching high-velocity SKUs across multiple categories: upholstery, casegoods, motion, and bedding.
* **Join a Growth-Obsessed Team:** We move fast, think big, and iterate quickly. You'll have both leadership and ownership.

**What You’ll be Doing:**

GTM Strategy & Category Ownership

* Own and manage **go-to-market plans**, calendars, and cross-functional launch workflows across all furniture categories
* Define **product positioning**, selling narratives, and consumer-facing benefits for each channel (DTC, retail, Amazon, Wayfair, etc.)
* Drive alignment with Merchandising and Development to prioritize the right SKUs for each seasonal launch

Messaging & Content Briefing

* Write and evolve **core messaging documents** and storytelling frameworks that drive marketing campaigns, packaging, PDPs, and retail content
* Partner with Creative and Brand teams to brief on **imagery, video, 3D renderings, and copy** needed for launch assets
* Ensure **channel-ready content** is accurate, timely, and compliant with each retailer or platform

Hub Between Departments

* Act as the central bridge between **Product Development, Merchandising, Sales, Creative, and Marketing**
* Align on timelines, product specifications, messaging priorities, and asset needs
* Run cross-functional meetings and checkpoints to keep all teams informed and accountable

Product Accuracy & Consumer Insights

* Partner with Data & Insights to validate claims, track reviews, and refine positioning over time
* Ensure accuracy of product names, specifications, claims, dimensions, and visual representation
* Maintain centralized systems for product content readiness and version control

Team Leadership

* Build and manage a high-performing team:
* Product Marketing Managers (by category)
* Content & Readiness Manager
* Launch Project Manager

Optional: Insights Analyst

* Foster a team culture of collaboration, creativity, and continuous improvement

**Skills & Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree required; advanced degree preferred
* 8–10 years of progressive experience in product marketing, brand marketing, or category leadership—ideally within home, furniture, or consumer goods industries
* Demonstrated success leading product launches across multiple channels, with expertise in DTC, marketplace, and wholesale environments
* Proven people leadership experience within high-growth, fast-paced businesses
* Strong ability to collaborate across functions, with direct experience partnering with Merchandising, Sales, Product Development, Creative, and Retail Marketing teams
* Exceptional communication, strategic thinking, and execution skills with a strong bias toward results
* Ability and willingness to travel as needed to support business objectives
* Background in organizations such as Wayfair, Amazon, Home Depot, or Steelcase a plus

*Reports to:*Head Merchant/Marketplace Category Lead & Chief Creative Officer

*Level:* Director (8–10 years experience)

**What We Offer** *(subject to eligibility requirements)***:**

Benefits: When you join our family, you are eligible to participate in our comprehensive benefits programs which includes Health, Dental, Vision, Life/Disability, Flexible Spending Accounts, 401(k), Paid Holidays, Paid Vacation. Benefits may vary based on position and location, so we encourage you to speak with the recruiting team during the interview process.

**Our Core Values:**

* Honesty & Integrity
* Passion, Drive, Discipline
* Continuous Improvement/Operational Excellence
* Dirty Fingernail
* Growth Focused

To learn more about Ashley Furniture, our community engagement programs, environmental stewardship, and our core values, please visit our Corporate Social Responsibility information page: **Corporate Social Responsibility**

**https://www.ashleyfurniture.com/about-us/corporate-social-responsibility/report/**

This company values its diversity and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made on the basis of an individual’s skills, qualifications, merit and business need.

jobs.description:
**About Us**

Ashley is America's largest furniture manufacturer and a global retail leader. We’ve been committed to delivering beautiful, quality home furnishings at an accessible price point for over 75 years. Now, we're evolving our brand to meet the changing lifestyles of today's consumers. This is an exciting time to join the team and make a real impact. You'll be part of a transformation, working with passionate professionals who are reshaping an industry and creating meaningful connections between our products and the lives they enhance.

**Position Summary**

The Regional Sales Manager for Electronics will lead sales initiatives across designated territories within Ashley's corporately owned retail markets. This role is responsible for driving brick-and-mortar sales performance of our Electronics category, ensuring seamless integration of electronics offerings into the customer shopping experience across all specified locations.

**Primary Job Functions**

**Sales Leadership & Territory Management**

* Drive Electronics category sales performance across assigned corporate retail territories
* Develop and execute regional sales strategies to maximize Electronics penetration in brick-and-mortar stores
* Lead, coach, and develop store teams to integrate Electronics selling into the customer journey
* Monitor and analyze sales metrics, market trends, and competitive landscape to identify growth opportunities
* Establish and maintain sales targets, KPIs, and performance benchmarks for the region

**Training & Development**

* Ensure consistent execution of Electronics selling techniques across all locations
* Train store teams to naturally incorporate Electronics into customer conversations throughout the sales journey
* Develop and implement best practices for Electronics product presentation
* Conduct regular store visits to provide hands-on coaching and support

**Operational Excellence**

* Ensure compliance with Electronics program standard operating procedures (SOPs)
* Maintain product accuracy and consistency across all regional locations
* Collaborate with merchandising and operations teams to optimize Electronics category performance
* Partner with vendors to maximize training and sales opportunities

**Strategic Planning**

* Identify market-specific opportunities and challenges within assigned territories
* Provide feedback and insights to leadership on market conditions, customer preferences, and competitive activities
* Support new store openings and Electronics category expansions

**Secondary Job Functions**

1. Maintain reliable attendance.
2. Actively participate in departmental meetings, training and education. Assist with training other employees and providing backup.
3. Complete other assignments and special projects as requested.

**Job Qualifications**

**Education:**

* Bachelor Degree in Business, Marketing, or related field or equivalent work experience, Required

**Experience:**

* 5+ years of experience in Sales Management, preferably in consumer electronics or home furnishing, Required
* Muti Unit Management experience, Preferred
* Consumer Electronics or Home Furnishings experience, Preferred

**Licenses or Certifications**

* None

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**

* Strong attention to detail
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Excellent interpersonal skills
* Effective time management and organizational skills
* Work independently as well as in a team environment
* Document management system
* Analytical and problem solving skills
* Maintain confidentiality
* Working knowledge of Continuous Improvement
* Handle multiple projects simultaneously within established time constraints
* Proficient computer skills, including experience with Microsoft Office Suite, internet
* Perform under strong demands in a fast-paced environment
* Work professionally with customers and co-workers to efficiently serve our customers, treating both with enthusiasm and respect
* Display empathy, understanding and patience with employees and external customers
* Respond professionally in situations with difficult employee/vendor/customer issues or inquiries

**Schedule Expectations**

1. This position will be required to travel frequently (up to 75%).
2. Flexible and willing to work extended hours when necessary.

**Job Competencies**

1. **Results-Oriented**: Consistently achieves and exceeds sales targets
2. **Leadership**: Inspires and motivates teams to perform at their best
3. **Customer-Focused**: Understands customer needs and delivers exceptional experiences
4. **Analytical Thinking**: Uses data to drive decisions and identify opportunities
5. **Communication**: Effectively communicates vision, expectations, and feedback
6. **Adaptability**: Thrives in a fast-paced, evolving retail environment

**Our Core Values**

* Honesty & Integrity
* Passion, Drive, Discipline
* Continuous Improvement/Operational Excellence

**Build Your Career with Ashley**

**Field Manager of Licensee Sales**

**What Will You Do?**

* Conduct ongoing location visits to identify and support the licensee in product training, merchandising and product assortments, partner on velocity walks and help support any additional areas of opportunity to help grow wholesale sales.
* Supports licensee new store openings and grand re-openings. Participates in new licensee onboarding.
* Participates in operational strategy meetings to devise execute best practices or improvement plans to address region licensee needs or correct identified issues.
* Ensures licensees in district remain in compliance with the TUA. Monitors brand standards, including product and visual, through a rigorous protocol of field visits and licensee self-reporting to help improve and continually enhance brand equity in the licensee community.
* Fosters the licensee network communication process, including field reports, weekly newsletters, quarterly business strategy meetings and reporting protocols. Maintains strong relationships with the region licensees. Resolves licensee issues and concerns.
* Attends Markets to help introduce licensees to new products and programs.
* Participates in quarterly Licensee Sales meetings to provide team building and support to licensees.
* Assists in the support of Tier 2-5 licensees as needed. Works as part of a team, plus on occasion will engage in deeper dives into problematic areas or developing opportunities as a member of a “strike force” approach.
* Promotes the Ashley brand image through active involvement in community associations and events, such as the Chamber of Commerce, Kiwanis, or Rotary Club or volunteer organizations.
* Demonstrates the company’s core and growth values in performance of all job functions.

**What Do You Need?**

* Bachelor’s degree required in Business Administration, Management, Marketing or related field or an equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered.
* Three to five years of retail sales and sales management or distribution center experience. Preferably with experience in furniture retail and fulfillment-based operations employing a license or franchise model.
* Visual Merchandising, Furniture or Training experience a plus.
* Exceptional knowledge of retail, sales and training operations processes.
* Willingness to travel 80%
* Ability to facilitate training and/ or presentations in front of small and large audiences.
* Strong business acumen, with demonstrated knowledge of finance, management, marketing and merchandising.
* Knowledge of licensed business owner or franchise law.
* Knowledge of training management and improvement methods and tools.
* Outstanding analytical and problem solving skills, with the ability to dig deep into the data and then turning that insight into action to drive results.

* Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to organize thoughts, communicate clearly, completely and concisely.
* Strong project/resource management and organizational skills, with the ability to consistently meet demanding deadlines.
* Strong skills in relationship management and coaching that result in the accomplishment of goals.
* Strong skills in agility, along with the ability to pivot easily when directions and priorities change on short notice.
* Strong skills in MS Office Suite or similar office software.

**Who Are We?**

At Ashley, we’re more than a business…we’re family. As the largest manufacturer of home furnishings in the world, we know what it takes to build incredible furniture and future leaders. We’re problem solvers with the grit to persevere during challenging times and innovators who won't coast when times are good. We create solutions, not excuses. And never settle for status quo. It’s the reason we’re always searching for better ways to delivering an exceptional customer experience. That's why Ashley Furniture is #1 in our industry.

Ready to grow? You’ve come to the right place. Ashley Furniture has a “Growth Mindset”, and once you join our team, you’ll learn from the best in the business.

Apply today and find your home at Ashley!

**Benefits We Offer**

* Health, Dental, Vision, Employee Assistance Program
* Paid Vacation (80 Hours), Holidays, and Your Birthday off
* Generous Employee Discount on home furnishings
* Professional Development Opportunities
* Ashley Wellness Centers (location specific) and Medical Tourism
* Telehealth
* 401(k) and Profit Sharing
* Life Insurance

**Our Core Values**

* Honesty & Integrity
* Passion, Drive, Discipline
* Continuous Improvement/Operational Excellence
* Dirty Fingernail
* Growth Focused

**About Us**

Ashley is America's largest furniture manufacturer and a global retail leader. We’ve been committed to delivering beautiful, quality home furnishings at an accessible price point for over 75 years. Now, we're evolving our brand to meet the changing lifestyles of today's consumers. This is an exciting time to join the team and make a real impact. You'll be part of a transformation, working with passionate professionals who are reshaping an industry and creating meaningful connections between our products and the lives they enhance.

**Position Summary**

The Regional Sales Manager for Electronics will lead sales initiatives across designated territories within Ashley's corporately owned retail markets. This role is responsible for driving brick-and-mortar sales performance of our Electronics category, ensuring seamless integration of electronics offerings into the customer shopping experience across all specified locations.

**Primary Job Functions**

**Sales Leadership & Territory Management**

* Drive Electronics category sales performance across assigned corporate retail territories
* Develop and execute regional sales strategies to maximize Electronics penetration in brick-and-mortar stores
* Lead, coach, and develop store teams to integrate Electronics selling into the customer journey
* Monitor and analyze sales metrics, market trends, and competitive landscape to identify growth opportunities
* Establish and maintain sales targets, KPIs, and performance benchmarks for the region

**Training & Development**

* Ensure consistent execution of Electronics selling techniques across all locations
* Train store teams to naturally incorporate Electronics into customer conversations throughout the sales journey
* Develop and implement best practices for Electronics product presentation
* Conduct regular store visits to provide hands-on coaching and support

**Operational Excellence**

* Ensure compliance with Electronics program standard operating procedures (SOPs)
* Maintain product accuracy and consistency across all regional locations
* Collaborate with merchandising and operations teams to optimize Electronics category performance
* Partner with vendors to maximize training and sales opportunities

**Strategic Planning**

* Identify market-specific opportunities and challenges within assigned territories
* Provide feedback and insights to leadership on market conditions, customer preferences, and competitive activities
* Support new store openings and Electronics category expansions

**Secondary Job Functions**

1. Maintain reliable attendance.
2. Actively participate in departmental meetings, training and education. Assist with training other employees and providing backup.
3. Complete other assignments and special projects as requested.

**Job Qualifications**

**Education:**

* Bachelor Degree in Business, Marketing, or related field or equivalent work experience, Required

**Experience:**

* 5+ years of experience in Sales Management, preferably in consumer electronics or home furnishing, Required
* Muti Unit Management experience, Preferred
* Consumer Electronics or Home Furnishings experience, Preferred

**Licenses or Certifications**

* None

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**

* Strong attention to detail
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Excellent interpersonal skills
* Effective time management and organizational skills
* Work independently as well as in a team environment
* Document management system
* Analytical and problem solving skills
* Maintain confidentiality
* Working knowledge of Continuous Improvement
* Handle multiple projects simultaneously within established time constraints
* Proficient computer skills, including experience with Microsoft Office Suite, internet
* Perform under strong demands in a fast-paced environment
* Work professionally with customers and co-workers to efficiently serve our customers, treating both with enthusiasm and respect
* Display empathy, understanding and patience with employees and external customers
* Respond professionally in situations with difficult employee/vendor/customer issues or inquiries

**Schedule Expectations**

1. This position will be required to travel frequently (up to 75%).
2. Flexible and willing to work extended hours when necessary.

**Job Competencies**

1. **Results-Oriented**: Consistently achieves and exceeds sales targets
2. **Leadership**: Inspires and motivates teams to perform at their best
3. **Customer-Focused**: Understands customer needs and delivers exceptional experiences
4. **Analytical Thinking**: Uses data to drive decisions and identify opportunities
5. **Communication**: Effectively communicates vision, expectations, and feedback
6. **Adaptability**: Thrives in a fast-paced, evolving retail environment

**Our Core Values**

* Honesty & Integrity
* Passion, Drive, Discipline
* Continuous Improvement/Operational Excellence
* Dirty Fingernail
* Growth Focused

**About Us**

Ashley is America's largest furniture manufacturer and a global retail leader. We’ve been committed to delivering beautiful, quality home furnishings at an accessible price point for over 75 years. Now, we're evolving our brand to meet the changing lifestyles of today's consumers. This is an exciting time to join the team and make a real impact. **Position Summary**

The Retail Experience Marketing Specialist is responsible for ensuring an exceptional in-store experience across bedding and electronics categories. This role manages all aspects of retail marketing execution, including signage coordination, vendor communication, store audits, and compliance with set standards. The specialist will serve as a key liaison between marketing, visual merchandising, vendors, and retail locations to ensure timely delivery and proper placement of all point-of-purchase (POP) materials.

**Key Responsibilities**

**Signage Execution**

o Coordinate ordering and delivery of signage for scheduled remodels, new store openings, and bedding or electronics campaigns.

o Brief in-store campaign POP assets, including signage placement and in-store video assets.

o Work with marketing to ensure all signage aligns with brand strategy and meets established standards.

o Maintain mattress gallery standards guide.

**Vendor & Store Coordination**

o Partner with construction team, merchants and vendors confirm timely shipment and arrival of marketing materials.

o Communicate with store teams to ensure proper POP placement and adherence to visual standards.

**Store Audits & Compliance**

o Conduct store audits to verify compliance with bedding and electronics visual standards.

o Provide detailed recaps and action plans for stores needing updates or corrections.

· Order Management

o Process bedding request forms submitted by stores for missing items required to meet standards.

o Place orders for additional signage or materials as needed to maintain compliance.

**Qualifications**

· Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Merchandising or related field (or equivalent experience).

· 3+ years of experience in retail marketing, visual merchandising, or related role.

· Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines.

· Excellent communication and vendor management skills.

· Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite; experience with project management tools a plus.

· Ability to travel for store audits and openings 50% of the time.

**Key Competencies**

· Detail-oriented and highly organized.

· Strong problem-solving and follow-through skills.

· Collaborative team player with ability to work cross-functionally.

jobs.description:
BASIC FUNCTION

The Sales Associate has the primary responsibility to maximize sales volume by growing existing business, developing new business, and providing the best possible customer service while enhancing Baker’s mission to offer the highest quality and service standards in the industry.

SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES: Customer Communication

• Greet customers in a friendly, professional manner and in a timely fashion (5 minutes or less).

• Assist all customers as called in rotation.

• Create and maintain quotations for customers who come into the Showroom or who call for information.

• Follow up on all quotations within one week and on a weekly basis.

• Inform customers of price increases two weeks prior to the increase occurring.

• Inform customers of discontinued product, extended lead times, etc.

• Provide customers with product information.

• Follow up with a thank you note or phone call to all new customers who come into the Showroom.

• Assist the designer’s client when the designer is unavailable.

• Assist end users when available or when requested by the manager.

• Always maintain professional courtesy with associates and customers.

• Consistently practice proper telephone etiquette.

• Return phone calls within 24 hours.

• Communicate with Showroom receptionist as to whereabouts if absent from Showroom. Order Entry

• Enter all orders into the system within 24 hours of receipt of the deposit or the purchase order (for net 30 accounts). Include all necessary information on the purchase order (i.e., customer information, delivery information, product options, pricing, etc.)

• Provide an adequate explanation to the customer for all denials of special requests on product and/or delivery dates. Customer Service

jobs.description:
**The Opportunity**Our retail expansion in the primary markets starts with hiring the best leaders. As a Sales/Operations Manager, you will focus on operational activities to grow the business. You will promote the Ballard Designs brand at every guest encounter and ensure your stellar team exemplifies brand values, standards, and experience. The dynamic energy from your leadership will increase company programs, increase sales, and set your store to exceed all expectations.  
  
You will report to the store leader.  
  
Your hiring location is **Tampa, Florida****Who We Are**Since 1982, Ballard Designs has offered a unique curation of home furnishings and décor from all periods and provenance. Its designers travel the world for inspiration, translating the latest fashion, color, and style trends into finely crafted products not found anywhere else. Ballard Designs is part of the Cornerstone brands - four interactive, aspirational home and apparel lifestyle brands that deliver inspirations that help customers enjoy, enhance, and celebrate life.  
  
**Your Impact**

* Perform a variety of operational activities, including scheduling, inventory management, backroom organization & store maintenance
* Experience with 'Division of Responsibility' understanding, competent in merchandise flow processes, including inspecting and receiving new merchandise and entering data into the inventory management system
* Manage the performance of the associates and provide feedback.
* Assure all back areas meet company standards of cleanliness and a safe work environment

**What You Bring**

* 3+ years of shipping and receiving management experience in the specialty retail industry
* Proficiency using Microsoft Word, Excel (can maintain complex spreadsheets), Outlook, Workday, Kronos, and POS Systems
* Lift and mobilize medium to large items, up to 50lbs
* Availability to work flexible schedule, including evenings, weekends, and holidays

Remote work is not permitted in NYC currently.  
  
#Onsite  
  
Our Total Rewards package includes benefits you’ll love such as competitive compensation, paid time off, an employee assistance program, parental leave, paid volunteer hours, and amazing company discounts! In our US market, you can also expect health care benefits starting on day 1, 401(k), and tuition reimbursement benefits. QVC Group is committed to inclusion and belonging for all and ensuring that our workplace provides equal employment opportunities for all team members and candidates and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations. As an equal opportunity employer, QVC Group is committed to a barrier-free employment process. If you need reasonable accommodations/support throughout, please contact us at workwithus@qvcgrp.com for assistance. If provided, salary ranges are a general guideline only, and actual salaries will vary and are based on factors such as a candidate's qualifications, skills, experience, and geographic location as well as business and market conditions.

**Job Description**We are seeking an enthusiastic and driven individual to assist the management team in our Balsam Hill Studio retail store at Whalers Village in Lahaina, HI. In the full-time Sales Associate role, you will have the opportunity to help ensure that our customers experience the magic of Balsam Hill in an inspired holiday setting.  
  
The Sales Associate will support the store management team by fostering a positive work environment that ensures customer satisfaction, boosts productivity, and drives sales. From enhancing the customer shopping experience to assisting with store opening and closing, the Sales Associate is vital to the success of Balsam Hill Studio. We are particularly excited about candidates with a proven history of retail success and creating customer-centric shopping experiences!  
  
**What You’ll Do**

* Assist customers and provide top notch service to ensure all patrons leave satisfied
* Assist with merchandising, cleaning, and restocking
* Gather customer feedback
* Achieve sales targets by generating revenue through effective sales strategies
* Perform opening/closing routines as needed
* Demonstrate exemplary customer service and selling skills

* Strong communication skills with customers and sales staff
* Demonstrated time management, organizational and multi-tasking skills
* Passion for exemplary service

* Proficiency with iPads, basic computer skills, and basic data entry (data entry very minimal overall)

jobs.description:
**Job Description**

Balsam Hill is seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Interim Project Coordinator to support the execution of key ecommerce and strategic initiatives over a three-month period. This part-time, interim role is ideal for a flexible and organised professional who can manage multiple workstreams, coordinate stakeholders, and ensure timely delivery of project milestones across digital and business transformation projects.

This position reports to the General Manager and Business Lead, Europe. This is a part-time, hybrid in-office position located in our Dublin office, which will require you to work three days in-office (Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday).

To ensure sufficient overlap with functional and cross-functional team members globally, some flexibility with this role's regular work schedule will be required. Most of our teams have overlap with early morning and/or early evening PST. Specific scheduling needs for this role will be discussed in the initial interview.

**What you’ll do:**

* Coordinate and track progress across ecommerce and strategic project initiatives, ensuring alignment with timelines and deliverables.
* Support project leads by preparing updates, reports, and presentations for internal stakeholders and senior management.
* Manage meeting schedules, documentation, and follow-up actions.
* Liaise with cross-functional teams, including marketing, merchandising, operations, and IT, to ensure project milestones are achieved.
* Assist with timelines, communication, and implementation of new tools or workflows.
* Maintain project trackers, budgets, and performance dashboards.
* Provide administrative and analytical support to the Strategic Projects team as needed.

**What you bring to the table:**

* Well-suited for graduates or early-career professionals who have hands-on experience managing projects, supporting eCommerce operations, or coordinating cross-functional business initiatives.
* Excellent organisational skills with strong attention to detail and the ability to manage multiple priorities.
* Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, and common project management tools (e.g., Slack, Asana, Jira).
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Able to adapt quickly within a fast-paced, changing environment.
* Self-starter with the ability to work independently and manage workload effectively within part-time hours.
* Demonstrated AI literacy, enabling effective understanding, interaction, and critical evaluation of AI technologies and applications across diverse business functions

**Notes:** This is a temporary position, expected to last through end of January

jobs.description:
**Job Description**The Director of eCommerce (Temporary) will play a significant role in building a best‐in‐class global eCommerce website and creating a superior home décor shopping experience. This role will be accountable for driving and monitoring our webstore performance via effective merchandising, A/B testing, personalization, and optimization projects. This person will be a key stakeholder in the creation of the eCommerce roadmap and a key contributor to our company roadmap and annual priorities.  
  
The Director of eCommerce (Temporary) will work closely with Product Management, UI/UX, Marketing, and Creative teams to build a conversion‐driven website design that supports the brand vision and seasonal campaigns and proves our brand value to our shoppers. This person will also work closely with Product Management and Technology teams to identify technology, processes, eCommerce software, and feature improvements that contribute to the overall growth and profitability of the business**.**This position reports to the VP of eCommerce and is based in our Redwood City office location. This role is expected to work in a hybrid model, which currently includes Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday in-office.  
  
**What You’ll Do**

* Guide and support a global team of eCommerce Merchandisers to deliver best in class shopping experiences on our international sites
* Oversee development of eCommerce site strategies including navigation, landing experiences, site search, and other tactical plans that will help meet and exceed conversion, revenue and profitability goals
* Participate in evaluating tool and systems opportunities that drive eCommerce features and efficiencies, including use of technology to deliver a best‐in‐class personalized merchandising experience
* Oversee eCommerce day‐to‐day responsibilities, including:
* Drive improvement for key page/category metrics (conversion, bounce, exit, revenue, engagement, etc.) through the optimization of online merchandising that enhances overall customer experience
* Drive innovation and optimization through testing and application of eCommerce best practices
* Monitor, meet, and report on eCommerce KPI's (conversion, bounce/exit, cart abandon, RPV, brand/category revenue, etc.) across devices, pages, and customer segments, and be able to explain the business drivers behind fluctuations in these metrics
* Collaborate with the Marketing, SEO, Merchants, Pricing, and Planning teams to define business goals for our brands to align on strategies that drive growth
* Partner with Creative by contributing to creative briefs, reviewing creative concepts against business goals, and identifying asset requirements
* Partner with Merchandising (physical product) to ensure that product goals and benefits are being translated onto our site in a way that is consistent with their strategies
* Partner with Product Management and Technology teams to ensure technical support for the execution of eCommerce projects and website operations
* Provide input for prioritization of eCommerce projects, bug fixes, and maintenance tasks that go to Website Operations, Creative, and/or Technology teams

**What You Bring To The Table**

* 14+ years of experience in eCommerce/Retail
* Exceptional analytical skills required
* Prior experience managing teams required; remote management preferred
* Ability to influence across functions and communicate across levels
* Prior experience in leading cross functional projects
* Experience in working with Creative, Product Management and/or Technology teams
* Bachelor’s Degree in Merchandising, Economics, General Business Management or equivalent

**Notes:** This is a temporary position, expected to work 40 hours per week and last through January 2026.  
  
**About Us:** Balsam Brands is a global, omnichannel retailer with roots in holiday and home décor. We strive for excellence in everything we do and present a unique opportunity for those seeking to have a meaningful impact in a people-first company that values relationship building, authenticity, and doing the right thing. We have steadily growing teams in Boise, the Bay Area, Dublin, the Philippines, Canada, and Mexico.  
  
The company's mission is to create joy together. We empower our team and partners to love what they do, provide products and experiences that inspire meaningful moments with family and friends, and give back to our families and communities in impactful ways. When you join Balsam Brands, you'll find a culture of caring people doing challenging work and building a welcoming workplace.  
  

* Check out our flagship brand, Balsam Hill: www.balsamhill.com
* Balsam Brands in Forbes: https://bit.ly/balsambrandsforbes2023
* Balsam Brands on LinkedIn: http://www.linkedin.com/company/balsam-brands/
* Glassdoor: https://bit.ly/balsambrands-glassdoor

**Benefits**At Balsam Brands, we strive to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package. For permanent, full-time team members, our current package includes:  
  

* Competitive compensation, including a cash-based incentive plan; salary is reviewed yearly and may be adjusted as part of the normal compensation review process
* Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage, with 100% of monthly premiums covered for team members, and 85%+ employer-paid premiums for other coverage tiers that include dependents
* Up to $2,000 annual funding toward HSA accounts
* Medical, transit, dependent care FSA
* Infertility coverage offered on all medical plans
* Generous parental leave program and flexible return options
* Company-paid life and AD&D insurance
* Company-paid short and long-term disability insurance
* 401(k) with dollar-for-dollar company match up to $4,000 per calendar year
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP) and other mental health and wellness perks
* Paid holidays, annual shutdown week, PTO, and volunteer time-off (VTO) packages
* Paid 5-week sabbatical leave after 10 years of employment
* Annual continuous learning benefit up to $1,000 per person, per fiscal year
* Up to $300 flexible reimbursement to support setup of new team member's work-from-home environment
* Generous team member merchandise discount
* Valuable extras: identity theft protection, subsidized parking, monthly wellness, pet insurance, accident & critical illness insurance

The base pay rate for this position is: $77-97 per hour.  
  
*At Balsam Brands, we strive to build a diverse, equitable, and inclusive team to fulfill our purpose to create joy together. Balsam Brands is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds, ages, abilities, and experiences to apply.
